title: Threshcrank - Blitzcrank & Thresh compilation video

embed.description: The famous Blitz / Thresh combo is something we use quite regularly. I've finally put in the time to get a video uploaded with some of the plays we pulled off (pun intended) over the past couple of weeks. If you enjoyed, please comment any suggestions, subscribe, and keep an eye out for new videos coming soon!

body:
Hey guys, we're finally trying to spend a little more time with our content releases and this is the first step towards doing so. A couple of us from **dubbrothers Australia** play the classic Blitz/Thresh combo in bot lane on a regular basis, so please check it out. I hope you enjoy.

If you have any suggestions or critics etc, please leave a comment on the video. Feel free to subscribe and stay tuned for new videos to be released soon! All support is much appreciated, alongside any feedback as we strive to improve.

Feel free to visit us @ dubbrothers.net or join our TeamSpeak @ teamspeak.dubbrothers.net:10807 if you want a chat. This is my first time posting here, so if any part of this thread violates the rules, I apologise and would appreciate the heads up! (:

replies.body:
Also, try and commentate your plays more.

Eg. More enthusiasm. 

I hope i'm not offending you.

epic hhaha, i main thresh/blitz so this vid is supoer fun to watch :)

check out the thresh vid i made for fun awhile back
http://youtu.be/MjqRbqc3NMY?list=UUGwE26NEx3AAW02ctpf-2kw

Thanks, I'm glad you enjoyed.

I watched your Thresh video also, just a couple pointers in case they're of any assistance:

- Try make sure you hook the carry, not the tank unless their CC is seriously disrupting your allies in team fights. You got away with it a lot in-lane but it's a risky move to Q-Q a Leona (for example).

- Hold your Q as long as possible to optimise the CC-chaining (pun intended). Try not to re-activate it until the second 'tug' animation is complete. Unless of course you're trying to make rapid plays.

- Your video was available in both 720p and 1080p; did something go wrong with the rendering? Try do a few test records & renders to remove the 'letterboxing' from your videos - it's much more appealing that way! (:

- Try keep your videos between 2-5minutes in length (3mins optimum). It wasn't as interesting toward the end as the video felt like it dragged on for so long, but a nice effort nonetheless.

You're probably more experienced on Thresh by now (as per the above suggestions), but the insight is there if it's of any use. Good luck with your future videos! (: I appreciate the support, expect more to come soon! (:

thanks for the tips mate :) ye the vid is pretty old now, but advice never hurts as i can always learn more :)

and yup, im noob at making videos hehe

The proper name for this is Fadeaway Pulls.

But still, nice vid.

Thanks for the notice; I have heard that term used within the community but don't generally abide by the term being published. I'll definitely keep it in my notes in case I see fit to use it, thank you! (:

I appreciate the support.
